titleStmt.title: The famous history of Aurelius the valiant London-prentice shewing his noble exploits at home and abroad, his love, and great success. very pleasant and delightful. Written for incouragement of youth, by J.S. This may by printed, R.P.
titleStmt.author: J. S. (John Shirley), fl. 1680-1702.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Back, at the sign of the Black Boy on London-Bridge,

notesStmt.note: Added engraved title page dated 1686; place of print from Plomer.
With an illustration and colophon on final page.
Identified as Wing (2nd ed.) S3506bA on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2112.
Dated [1685?] in Wing, which is apparently unaware of dated entraved title page.
Reproduction of the original in the Magdalene College Library, Cambridge.
